DOC.criteria: 18 year age old Status post bilateral cataract refractive lens surgery ( without LRI ) implantation Tecnis™ Multifocal IOL Crystalens™ HD Accommodating IOL Bestcorrected ETDRS equivalent visual acuity 20/30 good eye Naturally dilate pupil size ( dim light ) > 3.5 mm ( dilation medication ) eye Clear intraocular medium ( posterior capsular opacification , status post YAG capsulotomy ) Availability , willingness , sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedures Ocular disease could potentially limit uncorrected visual acuity visual performance . Use systemic ocular medication may affect visual outcome Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g . diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , etc . ) Uncontrolled systemic ocular disease History ocular trauma History ocular surgery require inclusion study Amblyopia strabismus Known pathology may affect visual acuity ; particularly retinal change affect vision ( macular degeneration , cystoid macular edema , proliferative diabetic retinopathy , etc . ) Diagnosed degenerative visual disorder ( e.g . macular degeneration , retinal disorder ) predict cause future acuity loss level bad 20/30 Subjects may expect require retinal laser treatment surgical intervention Capsule zonular abnormality may affect postoperative centration tilt lens ( e.g . pseudoexfoliation syndrome ) Pupil abnormality ( nonreactive , tonic pupil abnormally shape pupil )
